revised_title: A New Crinoid Species from the Southern Sea: Thaumatocrinus Renovatus
tldr: The author discovered a new crinoid species, Thaumatocrinus renovatus, from a deep-sea exploration in the Southern Sea. This unique crinoid has five simple arms and two distinct features not found in other Neocrinoids: large basals that completely separate the centrodorsal from the radials and an anal appendage. These characteristics make Thaumatocrinus renovatus an important find in the study of crinoids and deep-sea life.
